intro: Isopyrum peltatum, commonly known as the roundleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in moist, rocky habitats. The plant has a low-growing habit with clustered stems and small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pinkish-white and appear in clusters, blooming in late spring to early summer. Isopyrum peltatum is characterized by its unique leaf shape and is often found in alpine or arctic environments.
